pageContext.analysis: The Trump administration issued an intelligence report that affirmed that Russia is taking active measures to help Trump win in 2020 but muddied the waters by also highlighting possible Chinese and Iranian interest in the election outcome. "We assess that China prefers that President Trump – whom Beijing sees as unpredictable – does not win reelection," the report said, not pointing to any active measures by China in contrast to Russia. Only minimal efforts by Iran, such as "spreading disinformation on social media," were cited. A whistleblower at the Department of Homeland Security has alleged the agency was ordered by the White House to prioritize intelligence about possible Chinese interference over reporting on Russian meddling in the election. Conveniently, that information now turns up as part of Trump's campaign rhetoric.
